articles.author: Betsy Klein, Kevin Liptak, Kaitlan Collins and Kate Sullivan, CNN
articles.title: Biden to join NATO leaders in Brussels and attend European Council summit next week amid Ukraine war - CNN
articles.description: President Joe Biden will travel to Europe next week to meet with world leaders and discuss Russia's invasion of Ukraine, White House press secretary Jen Psaki said Tuesday.

articles.author: The Irish Times
articles.title: Russian strikes hit residential area of Kyiv as European leaders visit Ukraine capital - The Irish Times
articles.description: Kyiv mayor announces a 35-hour curfew as 2,000 civilian vehicles leave Mariupol
articles.content:
Officials from Russia and Ukraine are set to engage in another round of diplomatic talks as Moscows forces continue to attack the Ukrainian capital Kyiv and other cities across the country.

articles.title: Ukraine-Russia lunchtime briefing: Five developments as European leaders meet Volodymyr Zelensky in Kyiv - The Telegraph
articles.description: Plus: One child has been made a refugee every second and 40,000 Syrians are being put on standby to fight for Russia
articles.content:
Russia has drawn up lists of 40,000 fighters from the Syrian army and militia ranks to be put on standby for deployment in Ukraine, a war monitor reported today.

articles.title: Three EU leaders to visit Kyiv to show Ukraine support - Reuters.com
articles.description: Three European prime ministers were travelling to Kyiv on Tuesday, the first foreign leaders to visit the Ukrainian capital since Russia launched its invasion in a striking symbol of Ukraine's success so far in fending off Russia's assault.
articles.content: LVIV, Ukraine, March 15 (Reuters) - Three European prime ministers were travelling to Kyiv on Tuesday, the first foreign leaders to visit the Ukrainian capital since Russia launched its invasion in a… [+6537 chars]

articles.title: 'We can still stop the Russian war machine,' says Zelensky as up to 20000 civilians feared dead in Ukrainian city Mariupol, says official - Independent.ie
articles.description: Ukraine’s president has warned other European nations could be targeted by Russia as he urged them to help his country.
articles.content:

articles.title: Russia's war is going to make South African kotas and slap chips more expensive - Business Insider South Africa
articles.description: Most of the food oil consumed in South Africa is sourced from Europe, with Russia and Ukraine the key suppliers.
articles.content:
• Slap chips lovers and kota eaters are going to pay the price for Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

articles.author: Charlie Weston
articles.title: After years of cuts, mortgage rates now on the way up - Independent.ie
articles.description: The warning signs have been there for a while that mortgage lending rates were about to rise. Central banks around the world, including the European Central Bank, have been indicating that they will increase their key lending rates for banks.
